original_title: Sri Lanka IOC unit profits down in June quarter
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT  – Lanka IOC, a unit of Indian Oil Corporation has reported net profits of 2.4 billion rupees for the June quarter, sharply down from 9.9 billion a year earlier.
The firm reported earnings of 4.59 rupees per share for the quarter.

Revenues for the quarter rose to 54.7 billion rupees from 49.9 billion rupees, while cost of sales went up from 34.4 billion rupees to 49.2 billion rupees, with gross profits falling to 5.4 billion rupees from 15.49 billion rupees.
In the March 2023 quarter LIOC reported earnings of 13.48 rupees per share on total profits of 7.6 billion rupees.
LIOC profits have been high partly due to procurement inefficiencies at state-run Ceylon Petroleum Corporation amid a foreign exchange crisis, analysts say. (Colombo/June25/2023)
